ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] Guilds and groups
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Zuki, I have seen this on Karana as well. However, I m in a great guild because we are not just a guild, we are a family. We are small, about 30 members
ygData.messageBody:
Hi Zuki,

I have seen this on Karana as well. However, I'm in a
great guild because we are not just a guild, we are a
family. We are small, about 30 members with about 45
characters. In order to get in our family the entire
family votes and then the new person is adopted in
during a ceremony. It really is wonderful. We all have
the same last name as well and are recognized server
wide. Our charter is dedication to family, love,
honor, and loyalty and we go out of our way to help
others in need. I have many wonderful brothers and
sisters and have an adopted daughter as well.

Lilyana Stormseeker
Level 45 Paladin
Karana Server


--- Zuki Vekk <zuki@...> wrote:
> I've been playing EQ for a year and a half now, and
> one thing that I've come to believe is that the
> quality of guilds has definitely gone down hill.
> I've always thought of a guild as a group of
> friends, people that want to play together, or chat
> or hang out. Just recently, I was on as a newbie
> character I have and someone I didn't know just
> walked up to her and invited her into a guild.
>
> I'd love to join a small guild that everyone is
> friendly, that people get together for fun once in a
> while, no matter what their levels.
>
> So what do you all think, have guilds changed from
> what they once were?
>
> Zuki
>
> 29 cleric of Tunare and one damn proud dwarf!
>
>
> Angelfire for your free web-based e-mail.
> http://www.angelfire.com
>
